page.title: 13Coatestown Cottage (Past)
page.content: Robert Bricklebank age 11 Hundreds of years ago Hollinsclough was covered in forest.Laws were passed to allow people to make clearings and build their own cottages.People used gritstone,limestone and thatched roofs with heather.The people became owners.Nearly two hundred years ago a family called Harpur Crewe said "We'll repair your houses and put on stone roofs if you pay us rent". Later Harpur Crewe inherited the land and the people became tennants.The Coates family first lived in Coatestown Cottage (it was then called the Cottage of Content). Then the Armett's came,after that our Great Grandma came and Great Auntie Lizzie.Grandad persuaded Auntie Lizzie to move because the house was falling down,and when we moved to Coatestown the house was tumbled down.
